1.content:
Today started like any other day. The sun had risen to illuminate a cloudless sky, save of course for the Pegasi city of Cloudsdale, which was visible in the distance. Ponies of all shapes and sizes bustled about the small town of Ponyville, going about their daily business. Today was different, however. Today you were going to actually do something.

You had a new friend. Twilight Sparkle, a young unicorn from Canterlot. Before yesterday, you hadn't had much contact with the mulberry mare, but you wish you had. She was beautiful and talented, and had gained quite the reputation during her short time in town. She was well-known for her adept understanding of magic, it having earned her a renowned status on multiple occasions. Yes, she was practically famous. And you were her new acquaintance.

When you met yesterday, she had invited you to visit her for lunch, to talk and learn more about each other. And this is what you were going to do today.

You continue to trot down the same dirt road you have been for about five minutes, making your way to Ponyville's library. Finally, you halt before a large tree, probably the largest one in town. You easily recognize it as the library, as it appears to be more than just a tree, but a building. Yes, this is surely it. You approach the thick trunk of the tree, a wooden, double-segmented door greeting you. You knock on it without knowing why. It is a public library, after all.

A distant "Come in!" comes as a response from within, and you enter.
1.title: The Beginning

choices: "Sorry, you'll have to find somepony else, Twilight."
11.content:
You step into the hollow tree's interior, slowly looking about the room as you walk forward. You see a tremendous amount of books and scrolls, stacked onto shelves that appear to be carved into the elaborately-decorated wooden walls. The room is primarily circular, with a ringed wooden floor, as though the entire interior had been simply carved out of the tree. At the center of the room, there's a stump-table with a wooden bust of a stallion you don't recognize resting atop it.

You spend an abnormal amount of time examining your surroundings before actually laying eyes on the pony you're here to see. The mare is on the opposite side of the room, standing at a podium composed of what appears to be a tree stump. Her head is buried in a large book, her attention focused on it alone.

You decide to get her attention. You pipe in modestly. "Ahem. Excuse me, Miss Sparkle?"

"Huh? Who is it?" Her ears perk up as she yanks herself from the book. She looks around the room frantically before laying her eyes on you, putting on a relieved expression. "Oh, it's you! I'll be honest, I almost forgot you were coming today."

"And I guess you forgot that you told me to come in a moment ago, too, huh?" you reply jokingly.

Twilight chuckles nervously. "Heheh, I'm sorry. There's this really old book that I just dug up from a pile in the basement, and I guess I really got into it."

You chuckle as well. "Oh, that's alright. You mentioned lunch yesterday. What have you got planned?"

Twilight quickly explains her plans for the afternoon to you, and the two of you begin. The afternoon goes as-planned. The two of you have lunch and converse over the course of an hour or two. You didn't need her to tell you that she was a well-organized pony, as she obviously put a good amount of time into today's itinerary. When all was said and done, you both returned to the library.

"Thanks for inviting me to spend the afternoon with you, Twilight. I had a great time today!" you say to your new friend.

She replies. "Oh, it’s my pleasure! I love meeting and learning about new ponies. I hope we can do this again soon!"

And so you begin to take your leave. However, as you exit, you suddenly feel compelled to turn around and ask about that old book Twilight mentioned. You turn around, laying your gaze upon her. She's already buried her head in the book again.

You pipe up, just as modestly as you did when you first set foot into her abode. "Uh, Miss Sparkle?"

Her ears perk up, just as they did earlier. She turns to face you with a somewhat annoyed expression, waiting for what you have to say.

"You're really into that book. May I ask, what's so interesting about it?"

Twilight's expression lightens up a little. "What's interesting about it? I'm just trying to figure out what language it's in! It looks like a book of spells to me, but I can't be sure."

"If you think they look like spells, you should try to cast a few." you say.

She ponders this for a moment. "Well, I guess you’re right. I don't really have to understand them to cast them, but I don't know what any of them will do... I have an idea! Why don't you help me find out what they mean? I'm sure I'll be able to reverse anything that happens to you."

You mull this over... Should you help her find out if these are spells, and what they do if they are?

11112.content:
"Okay, let's do this," Twilight says as she takes the book with her violet aura, moving the pages and checking every single symbol. Suddenly she stops and says, "Aha! this one looks promising." She points the tip of her lavender hoof to the paper.

The unicorn's horn began to shine as her eyes analyze the shapes of the ink on the paper. Moments after, the ethereal magic of Twilight moves in the air until it reaches the body of her guest and sinks into his skin. "Whoah!" You say as the magic surronds your body until it dissipates into the air. A few moments after... nothing happens.

"Did it work?" You ask nerviously.

"It probably has a delayed effect or it's not something you can phyiscally see," Twilight replies, "Maybe we need to perform a few tests to know any significant changes in your body or psyche."

"Very well..." You say, anxious about what you'll find out.

Twilight takes some air and expels it slowly, walks to the stump and sits. Then she takes a feather and starts writing, "First of all, thanks to the apparently lack of visible changes, we need to know if your physical capabilities improved. I know this is precarious, but I'm going to take the heaviest books off the shelf and then give it to you, alright?"

You nod at her and move yourself to the other side. Twilight's horn shines and books from the room form a pile just above your right side.
You look at the insane amount of books, worried. "Twilight... what will happen if I'm not able to carry all of this?"

The lavender unicorn replies, "Relax, I'm not going to smash you. I'm going to put one book at a time until you say you can't hold it, okay?"
You lift your hoof and after a deep breath, you say, "Okay Twilight, I'm ready."

You see the first book lying in your right hoof, then two, three, four. You think, "Maybe this worked out after all..." Twilight continues to add more books. Seven, eight, nine...

Then you hear a pop followed by the sound of books falling to the floor. Both you and Twilight see your entire right leg lying on the floor. "Sweet Celestia!" You scream. Twilight stumbles and after a few moments, she says, “You're not bleeding. Tell me, do you feel any pain?”

Looking at your hoof, you reply, “Actually... no.” Twilight stands up and approaches your severed limb. She touches it with the tip of her feather. Surpisingly, you can feel it as your leg twitches a little.

The unicorn takes your hoof with her magic and examines the new flat stump on the side of your leg. It appears like it should attach to your shoulder, because the same kind of stump is on your shoulder. “It has new skin and a coat of the same color that surronds it,” says Twilight as rubs the feather with against the stump. Suddenly, you feel your right leg squirm by the reflex of your muscles. You chuckle a little at the sudden sensation.

“The new skin is very sensitive," she says, "Now one more thing... can you still control it?” While you stare at your detached hoof, you close your eyes, concentrate on your leg, and command it to bend itself. You feel your muscles contract, then open your eyes to see your floating leg bend in the air to your command.

Twilight walks toward you and puts your severed hoof against your shoulder. Suddenly, your leg reattaches to your body as if nothing had happened.
“You're kind of fragile now," she says, "You should avoid carrying heavy stuff.”
Now we can continue doing tests on you...

You were about to say something but once again, covered your ears as she spoke. "Wait here, I'm going to check something." She says as she walks to where the book that had the spell she used on you. You watch as the lavender pony flops on the ground and stuff her face in the book. You have a feeling you are stuck here for a while.

Hours has passed and you fell asleep. You woke up later...

info.brief_description: Even the most innocent of visits can go wrong when somepony gets curious!
info.description:
This story takes place in the My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic universe.
This is an interactive story that revolves around transformation and the fun that comes with it. Almost anything goes. Feel free to let most of your fetishes run wild, be it size changing, gender swapping, or whatever else you conjure up.

There are a few restrictions and preferences, however:

1. Please please please, don't skimp on grammar, spelling, and the like. Make sure your additions are readable and in English, as well.
2. No super-short additions, or ones that go completely off track. The story needs to make sense as it progresses.
3. All additions are to be written in second-person perspective. If you don't know what that is, look it up.
4. Try to avoid death as often as possible, or at least make sure readers have a choice other than death if it should come close.
5. The main character starts as an adult male. This is subject to change, of course, but I felt I should make this clear. Yes, transformation into a human is plausible.
6. The story isn't restricted to Twilight Sparkle. You're free to introduce other existing (OCs are a no-no) characters later on, but please make sure you do it in a way that makes sense.
7. I'm not going to stop you from adding content like scat and waterworks, but since I know a lot of people don't like it, please include some fair warning.
8. Leave plenty of open options. Story arcs that only go in one direction with no branching choices are dumb.

I'll check in from time to time and make sure everything is in order here. If I see and entry that seems to completely disregard these, I'll edit or remove it, depending on how severe it is.

Remember, anything goes, including homosexual content. That means that you may find material that offends you. Well, the solution to that is simple; Ignore it or shoo.

Note: I'm a mediocre writer. My contributions will probably be rare and not all that great. Sorry about that.

Now please, enjoy!
